Name: DN1210-027-001 - ITP Streetlighting - Ducting and Cable installation Rev 0
Prompting Name: DN1210-027-001 - ITP Streetlighting - Ducting and Cable installation

Name: SECTION 1 – MATERIAL, PERSONNEL & THIRD PARTY APPROVAL
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Pothole all services prior to commencement of trenching. Suitably protect the existing services from construction damage.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Confirm on site the exact location of cabling routes before trenching.
○ Where connecting and or coordinating with existing services, engineers shall make local modifications necessary for the correct operation of the entire system.
Verifying Document - Survey data/Comms with Client
1.1.3 - Location of Lighting Poles, Cameras, Cable Pits and Montrose Boxes
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Confirm with surveyor and mark out the exact locations of lighting poles, Cameras, Cable Pits and Montrose boxes before installation.
Verifying Document - Survey data/Comms with Client
Verifying Document - Coase Sand - PSD Report

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Under roads and paved areas: Coarse sand, controlled low strength material or fine crushed rock. In topsoil areas: Complete the backfilling with topsoil for at least the top 50mm.
Verifying Document - Material data sheet and engineers approval
Comments / Closeout Details - Backfill materials will either be site excavated GAP65 which had been approved at Earthwork stage) or Soil

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Use heavy duty HD PVC for underground services. Use best practice PVC where possible. Orange colour for all conduits containing consumer mains, sub-mains or final sub-circuits cabling
Verifying Document - Material data sheet and engineers approval
Comments / Closeout Details - Same power ducts applied as Utility works
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Aco Cablemate Polycrete "type 66" Dimension: 665mm x 665mm x 620mm with heavy duty steel lid.
Verifying Document - Material data sheet and engineers approval
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Keep trenches free of water
○ No sharp projections, roots and other obstructions.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Minimum 50mm separation from other conduits; Also follow separation requirements by utility operators when in shared trench.
○ Where services cross, install electrical conduit at the topmost
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Seal buried entries of ducts and conduits using waterproof seals and/or conduit fittings.
○ Seal spare ducts and conduits immediately after installation and seal other ducts and conduits after cable installation.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - As built every ducts joint before backfill to accurately record the routes of underground cables.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Install orange marker tape at 150mm or 50% of the depth of burial, whichever is greater, below finished ground level.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Backfill trenches as soon as possible after approval of laid and bedded service.
○ Place the backfill in layers < 150mm thick and compact to the density which applies to the location of the trenches to minimize settlement.
— Under maintenance pad, Clegg test will be used, with target CIV 25 for GAP65.
— Under berm area, no test needed on topsoil.
Verifying Document - Photo/Visual Inspection/Compaction result when under Road or paved areas
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Install cable pits as detailed on the drawings.
Verifying Document - Comms with WSP/ Photo/Visual Inspection
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - As-built drawings with
6) the individual addresses of each luminaire, and their corresponding groups (if DALI) shown clearly for maintenance purposes.
7) All changes to design to be noted, highlighted or markup clearly.
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Specifications and verifies lot compliance.
